alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Niobrara and northeastern Converse Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southwest of Bill to near Lusk. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lusk, Manville, Bill, Dull Center, Lance Creek, Redbird and Manning Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
